abstract: Commerce Dept reports United States trade deficit climbed 2.7 percent in December to $43.4 billion as American exports dropped 0.3 percent; shift highlights pressures of stronger dollar and growing global economic instability.
lead_paragraph: The United States trade deficit rose in December as American exports fell for a third consecutive month, reflecting the pressures of a stronger dollar and spreading global economic weakness.
snippet: The United States trade deficit rose in December as American exports fell for a third consecutive month, reflecting the pressures of a stronger dollar and spreading global economic weakness.
